info.description: Schematics Service is to provide the capability to manage resources of (cloud) provider infrastructure using file based configurations. With the Schematics service the customer is able to specify the required set of resources and their configuration in 'config files', and then pass these config files to the service to fulfill it by calling the necessary actions on the infrastructure. This principle is also known as Infrastructure as Code. For more information Please refer https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/schematics?topic=schematics-getting-started
info.title: Schematics Service API

get.summary: Return list of locations where schematics workspaces are supported.

parameters.description: The IAM access token associated with the IBM Cloud account. To generate the token, you can run ic iam oauth-tokens in the IBM Cloud CLI.
parameters.name: Authorization

200.description: Successfully returned list of workspace locations.

get.summary: Return list of resource groups associated with the provided account_id.

parameters.description: The IAM access token associated with the IBM Cloud account. To generate the token, you can run ic iam oauth-tokens in the IBM Cloud CLI.
parameters.name: Authorization

200.description: Successfully returned resource groups information.

get.summary: Display version information about this API.

200.description: Successfully returned version information.

post.summary: Delete an workspace. Run a destroy call first if you want to remove active resources, otherwise resources need to be managed outside of Schematics.

parameters.description: The IAM access token associated with the IBM Cloud account. To generate the token, you can run ic iam oauth-tokens in the IBM Cloud CLI.
parameters.name: Authorization

200.description: Successfully deleted the workspaces.

401.description: The authorization token for the request is missing, invalid, expired, or has no account. Check that the token value is correct or generate and use a new token.

403.description: Unauthorized access. Check that you have the correct access credentials and permissions.

409.description: Deletion failed. The workspace is marked as frozen. Unfreeze the workspace before you retry the request.

500.description: Internal server error. The Schematics service is currently unavailable. Please wait a few minutes and try again. If you still encounter this problem, contact IBM Cloud support.

get.summary: Retrieve the metadata for a given workspace in your IBM Cloud account.

parameters.description: The workspace ID for the workspace that you want to query. You can run the GET /workspaces call if you need to look up the workspace IDs in your IBM Cloud account.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The IAM access token associated with the IBM Cloud account. To generate the token, you can run ic iam oauth-tokens in the IBM Cloud CLI.
parameters.name: Authorization

200.description: Successfully retrieved details about your workspace.

401.description: The authorization token for the request is missing, invalid, expired, or has no account. Check that the token value is correct or generate and use a new token.

403.description: Unauthorized access. Check that you have the correct access credentials and permissions.

404.description: Not found. The requested workspace could not be located. Check that you have the correct workspace ID in your request.

500.description: Internal server error. The Schematics service is currently unavailable. Please wait a few minutes and try again. If you still encounter this problem, contact IBM Cloud support.

get.summary: Retrieve the metadata for all workspaces in your IBM Cloud account.

parameters.description: Offset in list (zero based)
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Maximum number of elements to return (default value 100, maximum value 2000)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: filter workspaces based on the region provided
parameters.name: region

parameters.description: The IAM access token associated with the IBM Cloud account. To generate the token, you can run ic iam oauth-tokens in the IBM Cloud CLI.
parameters.name: Authorization

200.description: Successfully retrieved details about your workspaces.

401.description: The authorization token for the request is missing, invalid, expired, or has no account. Check that the token value is correct or generate and use a new token

403.description: Unauthorized access. Check that you have the correct access credentials and permissions.

500.description: Internal server error. The Schematics service is currently unavailable. Please wait a few minutes and try again. If you still encounter this problem, contact IBM Cloud support.

post.summary: Create and define metadata about your workspace.

parameters.description: Workspace
parameters.name: workspace

parameters.description: The IAM access token associated with the IBM Cloud account. To generate the token, you can run ic iam oauth-tokens in the IBM Cloud CLI.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The github token associated with the GIT. Required for cloning of repo.
parameters.name: X-Github-token

201.description: Successfully created the workspace in the Schematics service. Your resources are not provisioned until you run the POST /workspaces/{id}/apply call.

400.description: Bad request. Check that the information you entered in the payload is complete and formatted correctly in JSON.

401.description: The authorization token for the request is missing, invalid, expired, or has no account. Check that the token value is correct or generate and use a new token.

403.description: Unauthorized access. Check that you have the correct access credentials and permissions.

404.description: Conflict. The workspace already exists. You can run the GET /workspaces call if you need to look up all workspaces in your IBM Cloud account.

500.description: Internal server error. The Schematics service is currently unavailable. Please wait a few minutes and try again. If you still encounter this problem, contact IBM Cloud support.

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: true, True or 1 will do destroy before deleting
parameters.name: destroy_resources

parameters.description: true, True or 1 will do destroy before deleting. Use destroy_resources
parameters.name: destroyResources

401.description: The authorization token for the request is missing, invalid, expired, or has no account. Check that the token value is correct or generate and use a new token.

parameters.name: id

200.description: Successfully retrieved the activity.

401.description: Unauthorized. The IAM token is invalid or expired. To retrieve your IAM token, run `ibmcloud login` and then `ibmcloud iam oauth-tokens`.

404.description: The requested workspace or activity cannot be located. Check that you have the correct workspace and activity IDs in your request.

parameters.description: false value will remove the statement where full terraform command is logged. Refer to https://github.ibm.com/blueprint/product/issues/1716

parameters.description: false value will remove the terraform command from the logs. Refer to https://github.ibm.com/blueprint/product/issues/1716
parameters.name: log_tf_prefix

parameters.description: false value will remove the null resource prefix from the logs. Refer to https://github.ibm.com/blueprint/product/issues/1716
parameters.name: log_tf_null_resource

parameters.description: true value will format the logs to withhold the original format of ansible output. Refer to https://github.ibm.com/blueprint/product/issues/1716
parameters.name: log_tf_ansible

parameters.description: The IAM access token associated with the IBM Cloud account. To generate the token, you can run ic iam oauth-tokens in the IBM Cloud CLI.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The workspace ID for the workspace that you want to query. You can run the GET /workspaces call if you need to look up the workspace IDs in your IBM Cloud account.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The Template ID for which you want to get the values. You can run the GET /workspaces call if you need to look up the workspace IDs or template IDs in your IBM Cloud account.
parameters.name: template_id

parameters.description: The IAM access token associated with the IBM Cloud account. To generate the token, you can run ic iam oauth-tokens in the IBM Cloud CLI.
parameters.name: Authorization

200.description: Successfully retrieved the values used for the template.

401.description: The authorization token for the request is missing, invalid, expired, or has no account. Check that the token value is correct or generate and use a new token.

403.description: Unauthorized access. Check that you have the correct access credentials and permissions.

404.description: The requested workspace cannot be located. Check that you have the correct workspace in your request. Or the requested statefile cannot be located. Run apply action to create a statefile.

500.description: Internal server error. The Schematics service is currently unavailable. Please wait a few minutes and try again. If you still encounter this problem, contact IBM Cloud support.

get.summary: Retrieve the metadata for the template of a given workspace in your IBM Cloud account.

200.description: Successfully retrieved template metadata for your workspace.

401.description: The authorization token for the request is missing, invalid, expired, or has no account. Check that the token value is correct or generate and use a new token.

403.description: Unauthorized access. Check that you have the correct access credentials and permissions.

404.description: Not found. The requested workspace/template could not be located. Check that you have the correct workspace ID and template ID in your request.

500.description: Internal server error. The Schematics service is currently unavailable. Please wait a few minutes and try again. If you still encounter this problem, contact IBM Cloud support.

get.summary: View the readme for the source repository.

parameters.description: The workspace ID for the workspace that you want to query. You can run the GET ,workspaces call if you need to look up the workspace IDs in your IBM Cloud account.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The name of the commit/branch/tag. Default, the repositorys default branch (usually master)
parameters.name: ref

parameters.description: The format of the output. Value 'markdown' will give mardown, otherwise html
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: The IAM access token associated with the IBM Cloud account. To generate the token, you can run ic iam oauth-tokens in the IBM Cloud CLI.
parameters.name: Authorization

200.description: Successfully retrieved the readme for the source repository.

400.description: The source URL format is invalid, the source repository is not supported by Schematics, or the source repository API returns an HTTP error.

401.description: The authorization token for the request is missing, invalid, expired, or has no account. Check that the token value is correct or generate and use a new token.

403.description: Unauthorized access. Check that you have the correct access credentials and permissions.

404.description: Readme retrieval failed because Git returned an HTTP error.

500.description: Internal server error. The Schematics service is currently unavailable. Please wait a few minutes and try again. If you still encounter this problem, contact IBM Cloud support.

ActionActivityRequest.description: ActionActivityRequest ActionActivityRequest - request passed for activity creation

ActionCreateRequest.description: ActionCreateRequest ActionCreateRequest - request passed in create

ActionUpdateRequest.description: ActionUpdateRequest ActionUpdateRequest - request passed in update

DateTime.description:
DateTime is a time but it serializes to ISO8601 format with millis
It knows how to read 3 different variations of a RFC3339 date time.
Most APIs we encounter want either millisecond or second precision times.
This just tries to make it worry-free.

InputsEnvVarsItems0Metadata.description: InputsEnvVarsItems0Metadata inputs env vars items0 metadata
